channel.title: AI Unfiltered
channel.description: Chinese AI • Open Source • Security • Incidents. Signal, not noise.

item.title: OpenAI Launches ChatGPT Health with Isolated, Encrypted Health Data Controls
item.description: Artificial intelligence (AI) company OpenAI on Wednesday announced the launch of ChatGPT Health, a dedicated space that allows users to have conversations with the chatbot about their health. To that end, the sandboxed experience offers users the optional ability to securely connect medical records...

item.title: M3MAD-Bench: Are Multi-Agent Debates Really Effective Across Domains and Modalities?
item.description: arXiv:2601.02854v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: As an agent-level reasoning and coordination paradigm, Multi-Agent Debate (MAD) orchestrates multiple agents through structured debate to improve answer quality and support complex reasoning. However, existing research on MAD suffers from two...

item.title: SimRPD: Optimizing Recruitment Proactive Dialogue Agents through Simulator-Based Data Evaluation and Selection
item.description: arXiv:2601.02871v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Task-oriented proactive dialogue agents play a pivotal role in recruitment, particularly for steering conversations towards specific business outcomes, such as acquiring social-media contacts for private-channel conversion. Although supervised...

item.title: ReTreVal: Reasoning Tree with Validation -- A Hybrid Framework for Enhanced LLM Multi-Step Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2601.02880v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multi-step reasoning remains a key challenge for Large Language Models (LLMs), particularly in complex domains such as mathematics and creative writing. While recent approaches including ReAct, Reflexion, and Self-Refine improve reasoning through...

item.title: Logical Phase Transitions: Understanding Collapse in LLM Logical Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2601.02902v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Symbolic logical reasoning is a critical yet underexplored capability of large language models (LLMs), providing reliable and verifiable decision-making in high-stakes domains such as mathematical reasoning and legal judgment. In this study, we...

item.title: Batch-of-Thought: Cross-Instance Learning for Enhanced LLM Reasoning
item.description: arXiv:2601.02950v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Current Large Language Model reasoning systems process queries independently, discarding valuable cross-instance signals such as shared reasoning patterns and consistency constraints. We introduce Batch-of-Thought (BoT), a training-free method that...

item.title: Lightweight Transformer Architectures for Edge Devices in Real-Time Applications
item.description: arXiv:2601.03290v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The deployment of transformer-based models on resource-constrained edge devices represents a critical challenge in enabling real-time artificial intelligence applications. This comprehensive survey examines lightweight transformer architectures...

item.title: Why LLMs Aren't Scientists Yet: Lessons from Four Autonomous Research Attempts
item.description: arXiv:2601.03315v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We report a case study of four end-to-end attempts to autonomously generate ML research papers using a pipeline of six LLM agents mapped to stages of the scientific workflow. Of these four, three attempts failed during implementation or evaluation....

item.title: Ratio-Variance Regularized Policy Optimization for Efficient LLM Fine-tuning
item.description: arXiv:2601.03320v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: On-policy reinforcement learning (RL), particularly Proximal Policy Optimization (PPO) and Group Relative Policy Optimization (GRPO), has become the dominant paradigm for fine-tuning large language models (LLMs). While policy ratio clipping stabilizes...

item.title: Aligning Findings with Diagnosis: A Self-Consistent Reinforcement Learning Framework for Trustworthy Radiology Reporting
item.description: arXiv:2601.03321v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Multimodal Large Language Models (MLLMs) have shown strong potential for radiology report generation, yet their clinical translation is hindered by architectural heterogeneity and the prevalence of factual hallucinations. Standard supervised...

item.title: HEEGNet: Hyperbolic Embeddings for EEG
item.description: arXiv:2601.03322v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Electroencephalography (EEG)-based brain-computer interfaces facilitate direct communication with a computer, enabling promising applications in human-computer interactions. However, their utility is currently limited because EEG decoding often...

item.title: DeepResearch-Slice: Bridging the Retrieval-Utilization Gap via Explicit Text Slicing
item.description: arXiv:2601.03261v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Deep Research agents predominantly optimize search policies to maximize retrieval probability. However, we identify a critical bottleneck: the retrieval-utilization gap, where models fail to use gold evidence even after it is retrieved, due to context...

item.title: Internal Reasoning vs. External Control: A Thermodynamic Analysis of Sycophancy in Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.03263v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models frequently exhibit sycophancy, prioritizing user agreeableness over correctness. We investigate whether this requires external regulation or can be mitigated by internal reasoning alone. Using CAP-GSM8K (N=500), an adversarial...

item.title: Jailbreak-Zero: A Path to Pareto Optimal Red Teaming for Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2601.03265v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This paper introduces Jailbreak-Zero, a novel red teaming methodology that shifts the paradigm of Large Language Model (LLM) safety evaluation from a constrained example-based approach to a more expansive and effective policy-based framework. By...

item.title: Benchmarking and Adapting On-Device Large Language Models for Clinical Decision Support
item.description: arXiv:2601.03266v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large language models (LLMs) have rapidly advanced in clinical decision-making, yet the deployment of proprietary systems is hindered by privacy concerns and reliance on cloud-based infrastructure. Open-source alternatives allow local inference but...

item.title: OpenAI GPT-5 System Card
item.description: arXiv:2601.03267v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: This is the system card published alongside the OpenAI GPT-5 launch, August 2025. GPT-5 is a unified system with a smart and fast model that answers most questions, a deeper reasoning model for harder problems, and a real-time router that quickly...

item.title: CISA Flags Microsoft Office and HPE OneView Bugs as Actively Exploited
item.description: The U.S. Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) on Wednesday added two security flaws impacting Microsoft Office and Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE) OneView to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) catalog, citing evidence of active exploitation. The vulnerabilities are listed...

item.title: Diagens Biotechnology Updates IPO Prospectus as Revenue Surges 470% in First Three Quarters
item.description: Medical AI firm Diagens Biotechnology is advancing its Hong Kong IPO bid after reporting Q1-Q3 2025 revenue of USD 15.46M, a 470% year-on-year increase, driven by its flagship AI AutoVision® software.

item.title: Luchen Technology Launches Serverless Fine-Tuning SDK, Claims Full RL Pipeline Costs Just USD 1.19
item.description: Luchen Technology released a Serverless fine-tuning SDK, dramatically lowering the cost and complexity of AI model training. It claims a full reinforcement learning pipeline can run for as low as USD 1.19.

item.title: Amap’s “Street Sweep Rankings” Surpass 660 Million Users in 100 Days, Launch 2026 “Live Rankings” Upgrade
item.description: Amap's "Street Sweep Rankings" feature attracted over 660 million users in just 100 days. Its 2026 upgrade introduces dynamic, AI-powered lists that adapt in real-time to offer hyper-local dining and activity guides.

item.title: AGIBOT Unveils Open-Source Simulation Platform Genie Sim 3.0 at CES 2026
item.description: Robotics company AGIBOT launched Genie Sim 3.0, an open-source, LLM-driven simulation platform at CES 2026. It enables rapid generation of tens of thousands of digital twin scenarios for robot training.

item.title: Z.ai’s Hong Kong Grey Market Trading Surges Nearly 20% Ahead of January 8 Listing
item.description: Chinese AI company Z.ai saw its shares surge nearly 20% in Hong Kong grey market trading, ahead of its official listing on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange on January 8. The IPO is priced at HKD 116.20 per share.

item.title: Black Cat Behind SEO Poisoning Malware Campaign Targeting Popular Software Searches
item.description: A cybercrime gang known as Black Cat has been attributed to a search engine optimization (SEO) poisoning campaign that employs fraudulent sites advertising popular software to trick users into downloading a backdoor capable of stealing sensitive data. According to a report published by the National...

item.title: The Loudest Voices in Security Often Have the Least to Lose
item.description: Security advice fails when it comes from those who don’t bear the consequences and won’t be responsible for making it work. The post The Loudest Voices in Security Often Have the Least to Lose appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: 8 plots that explain the state of open models
item.description: Measuring the impact of Qwen, DeepSeek, Llama, GPT-OSS, Nemotron, and all of the new entrants to the ecosystem.

item.title: Chrome Extensions With 900,000 Downloads Caught Stealing AI Chats
item.description: Impersonating a legitimate extension from AITOPIA, the two malicious extensions were also exfiltrating users’ browser activity. The post Chrome Extensions With 900,000 Downloads Caught Stealing AI Chats appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Deploying a hybrid approach to Web3 in the AI era
item.description: When the concept of “Web 3.0” first emerged about a decade ago the idea was clear: Create a more user-controlled internet that lets you do everything you can now, except without servers or intermediaries to manage the flow of information. Where Web2, which emerged in the early 2000s, relies on...

item.title: Vulnerability in Totolink Range Extender Allows Device Takeover
item.description: An error in the firmware-upload handler leads to devices starting an unauthenticated root-level Telnet service. The post Vulnerability in Totolink Range Extender Allows Device Takeover appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Critical n8n Vulnerability (CVSS 10.0) Allows Unauthenticated Attackers to Take Full Control
item.description: Cybersecurity researchers have disclosed details of yet another maximum-severity security flaw in n8n, a popular workflow automation platform, that allows an unauthenticated remote attacker to gain complete control over susceptible instances. The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2026-21858 (CVSS...

item.title: Agentic Rubrics as Contextual Verifiers for SWE Agents
item.description: Verification is critical for improving agents: it provides the reward signal for Reinforcement Learning and enables inference-time gains through Test-Time Scaling (TTS). Despite its importance, verification in software engineering (SWE) agent settings often relies on code execution, which can be...

item.title: Several Code Execution Flaws Patched in Veeam Backup & Replication
item.description: Four vulnerabilities have been fixed in the latest release of Veeam Backup & Replication. The post Several Code Execution Flaws Patched in Veeam Backup & Replication appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: The Download: war in Europe, and the company that wants to cool the planet
item.description: This is today’s edition of The Download, our weekday newsletter that provides a daily dose of what’s going on in the world of technology. Europe’s drone-filled vision for the future of war Last spring, 3,000 British soldiers deployed an invisible automated intelligence network, known as...

item.title: Cybersecurity Firms Secured $14 Billion in Funding in 2025: Analysis
item.description: 2025 was the strongest year for cybersecurity funding since the 2021 peak, according to Pinpoint Search Group. The post Cybersecurity Firms Secured $14 Billion in Funding in 2025: Analysis appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Webinar: Learn How AI-Powered Zero Trust Detects Attacks with No Files or Indicators
item.description: Security teams are still catching malware. The problem is what they're not catching. More attacks today don't arrive as files. They don't drop binaries. They don't trigger classic alerts. Instead, they run quietly through tools that already exist inside the environment — scripts, remote access,...

item.title: LLMs contain a LOT of parameters. But what’s a parameter?
item.description: MIT Technology Review Explains: Let our writers untangle the complex, messy world of technology to help you understand what’s coming next. You can read more from the series here. item.title: The man who made India digital isn’t done yet
item.description: Nandan Nilekani can’t stop trying to push India into the future. He started nearly 30 years ago, masterminding an ongoing experiment in technological state capacity that started with Aadhaar—the world’s largest digital identity system. Aadhaar means “foundation” in Hindi, and on that bedrock...

item.title: Benchmark^2: Systematic Evaluation of LLM Benchmarks
item.description: The rapid proliferation of benchmarks for evaluating large language models (LLMs) has created an urgent need for systematic methods to assess benchmark quality itself. We propose Benchmark^2, a comprehensive framework comprising three complementary metrics: (1) Cross-Benchmark Ranking Consistency,...

item.title: Powering up (and saving) the planet
item.description: Water shortages in Southern California made an indelible impression on Evelyn Wang ’00 when she was growing up in Los Angeles. “I was quite young, perhaps in first grade,” she says. “But I remember we weren’t allowed to turn our sprinklers on. And everyone in the neighborhood was given disinfectant...

item.title: EpiQAL: Benchmarking Large Language Models in Epidemiological Question Answering for Enhanced Alignment and Reasoning
item.description: Reliable epidemiological reasoning requires synthesizing study evidence to infer disease burden, transmission dynamics, and intervention effects at the population level. Existing medical question answering benchmarks primarily emphasize clinical knowledge or patient-level reasoning, yet few...

item.title: ThinkRL-Edit: Thinking in Reinforcement Learning for Reasoning-Centric Image Editing
item.description: Instruction-driven image editing with unified multimodal generative models has advanced rapidly, yet their underlying visual reasoning remains limited, leading to suboptimal performance on reasoning-centric edits. Reinforcement learning (RL) has been investigated for improving the quality of image...
